meanings.definition: A port or harbor outside a city or main port.
meanings.sent1: The small outports along the coast are vital for local fishermen.
meanings.sent2: Ships often stop at outports to unload cargo before heading to the main city port.
meanings.sent3: The outports were so quiet that the seagulls seemed to be the only ones enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, the outports are like tiny dots of civilization on a blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the outports under the setting sun was truly breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The act of exporting goods from a port.
meanings.sent1: The outports' business thrived as more merchants sought to expand their markets.
meanings.sent2: Global trade relies heavily on the efficiency of outports for shipping goods worldwide.
meanings.sent3: The outports' competition for trade was fierce, like a race to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The outports buzzed with activity, like busy bees in a hive of commerce.
meanings.sent5: The success of the outports was evident in the bustling docks and warehouses.

meanings.definition: To send goods to a foreign port for sale.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to outports their surplus products to reach new customers.
meanings.sent2: Businesses often outports goods to tap into international markets.
meanings.sent3: The decision to outports the goods was met with excitement by the sales team.
meanings.sent4: She outports her handmade crafts with pride, knowing they will be appreciated abroad.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to outports their products opened up a world of possibilities for the small business.
